title: First Law of Thermo - Work done cyclic process

content.question: When the gas is in State <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, it has a pressure of <math alttext="1.5 times 10 to the 5 power pascals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Pa</mtext></mstyle></math>, and a volume of <math alttext="2.0 times 10 to the negative 5 power meters cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></math>. The magnitude of the work done by the gas on its surroundings during one complete cycle <math alttext="state A to state B, to state C, to state A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>A</mtext><mo>→</mo><mtext>B</mtext><mo>→</mo><mtext>C</mtext><mo>→</mo><mtext>A</mtext></mstyle></math> is most nearly which of the following?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
